sentence.Network_en: The room's style exemplifies his ideal of beauty and plainness.
sentence.Network_cn: 这房间的风格说明了他对美与质朴的憧憬.

sentence.Network_en: Because of his plainness of speech, he succeeded in making his point.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于他措词清楚, 他成功地表明了自己的观点.

sentence.Network_en: Strong resolution makes a great cause out of plainness.
sentence.Network_cn: 坚定的信心,能使平凡的人们做出心人的事业.

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being unmixed with other material;
2. clarity as a consequence of being perspicuous
3. the appearance of being plain and unpretentious
4. an appearance that is not attractive or beautiful;

sentences.sentence: "fine clothes could not conceal the girl's homeliness"

auth_sentence.content: There was nothing unpardonable in Miss Bridgeman's plainness.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was nothing unpardonable in Miss Bridgeman's plainness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was nothing unpardonable in Miss Bridgeman's plainness.

auth_sentence.content: But his plainness was attractive to her.
auth_sentence.res_content: But his plainness was attractive to her.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But his plainness was attractive to her.

auth_sentence.content: He has never made a secret of valuing clarity over irony and northern plainness over metropolitan chic.
auth_sentence.res_content: He has never made a secret of valuing clarity over irony and northern plainness over metropolitan chic.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has never made a secret of valuing clarity over irony and northern plainness over metropolitan chic.
